answer:
The answer is : 

Carl Linnaeus, known as Carolus Linnaeus, was a Swedish botanist, zoologist, entomologist, ornithologist, taxonomist, and zoogeographer. 

Born in 1707 in the town of Lapland, north of Stockholm, Linnaeus was the son of a parson. He entered the University of Uppsala at the age of 15, where he studied botany and became acquainted with the herbarium of the botany professor, Elias Fries. In
